Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gaegurin-1  (Gaegurin 1, GGN1, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, Korean wrinkled frogRana rugosa, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against M. luteus (MIC5 ug/ml), S. epidermidis, B. subtilis, P. putida, P. aeruginosa (MIC 50 ug/ml), S. dysentariae, E. coli (MIC25 ug/ml) and K. pneumoniae (MIC100 ug/ml). (MIC data provided by Chunfeng Wang). It also ruptured protozoan A. proteus at 25 ug/ml in a few minutes.Toxicity:  Poor hemolysis (0.6%) at 100 ug/ml using 10% hRBCs. Updated 9/2017; 5/2020.
Literature Information.Author: Park JM, Jung J-E, Lee BJ.1994
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
